title: Riot's unreal ban system.
body: So I was playing a game as a jungler on my account that recieved a 14 day suspension. DIM RACK is the summoner name. I got nothing but flame coming from the mid laner and support. They threatened to report me multiple times because all 3 lanes were asking for help and I can not assist all 3 lanes at once. This was paired by them calling me a "F**king idiot" and telling me to learn how to jungle. This was in an unranked blind game. I did not respond negatively in any way I only gave them response to their poor behavior which did not even include me cursing them out like they did me.... I responded in oks and carried on with my game. I believe I handled myself rather well and in no way was toxic, let alone to warrant a 14 day ban. Being subject to the ban, I now realize how your ban system works. If 3 or more people report you it doesn't matter what you say or do, you're getting penalized no matter what. This is an unjust ban system as people who simply just want to play the game get penalized when something doesn't go another player's way. Again, I did not curse AT ALL or backlash at my teammates and STILL recieved a ban but they did not. This is crazy. I am asking Riot, that you review my chat logs for that game and PLEASE reconsider this ban.

replies.body:
Locking post due to its severe age.

If you have any questions, please contact us on Discuss the Boards or the Boards Discord.

Hi DIM RACK,

We take false positives very seriously and don't want players unfairly penalized so I took a deeper look here.

The first thing I noticed is that the logs posted here have been modified and aren't the complete logs provided in your reform card. If you'd like, I can post them here. However, based on the missing lines from the actual chat logs, I believe you know why this account received a penalty.

While I appreciate the sentiment, it's important to remember that responses like this are unhelpful.

Please clarify that he got punished because he  escalated after a second chat restriction, and that after 2 punishments the system pretty much expect you to be an example and become more sensitive about stuff you say and the frequency you say it.

> [{quoted}](name=Siegfriedx1,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=blsvU1r0,comment-id=0007000300000002,timestamp=2018-06-30T02:27:13.363+0000)
>
> Please clarify that he got punished because he  escalated after a second chat restriction, and that after 2 punishments the system pretty much expect you to be an example and become more sensitive about stuff you say and the frequency you say it.
> 
> There is absolutely nothing that would be worth a ban in this chat or a chat restriction to be honest. He is being kinda annoying but that is it. I know plenty of people and I can give out all the names that do that kind of thing and don`t get punished because it happens just now and then.

Yes, this not the account's first penalty and is basically their 3rd offense going through the normal escalation system, as described here:

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207489286-Instant-Feedback-System-FAQ-

The system escalates the penalty in hopes that the player will understand a stronger signal (suspension) and change their approach, because the weaker signal (chat restriction) hasn't worked for them to encourage sufficient improvement based on the community and system's eyes (as they're still offending players and getting reports deemed valid). Certainly there are more extreme phrases and language that players may be used that that could accelerate the process and jump a few steps to an immediate ban for instance, things along the lines of hate speech or death threats, but that's not the path this case took.


While the language in this particular chat log wouldn't have incurred an immediate ban, there are elements of negativity and harassment which could hurt other players and could be penalty-worthy offenses, especially if we're considering the implications of phrases. For example, calling for reports. Let's dive into that a bit.

Despite the word phrasing sounding benign on the surface ("report" isn't a bad word on its own) when someone calls for another player to be reported, there's a few implications under the hood, which really result in an attack on the player:

1. they're publicly expressing frustration towards another player
2. they're associating the target player with someone who exemplifies behaviors that would be valid to report for
3. they're asking for something negative to happen to the target player, like a chat restriction, ban, or worse.
4. and if they're doing it in All chat especially, they're also asking everyone else in the game to join in and gang up to hurt this player, context or no context, and maybe even seeking validation from others on the negative feelings they have towards the target player

...and the target player on the receiving end of this probably feels all these things in some shape or form. Unless you're friends, in a premade, or just happen to click with someone's personality, you'll risk the target player taking it negatively and feel attacked, hurt, and maybe even frustrated enough to submit a report at the end of game.

BONUS: For those who are looking to learn and aren't sure how to assess how others may interpret what they're saying, here's my personal high level take, which is basically 3 questions I ask myself: (examples included for fun)

1. Do i have good intentions behind my statements? (e.g., am i saying something because I'm angry and want to vent, or is there something genuine to be discussed here or something that needs to be clarified?)
2. Is what I'm saying/doing good for me? (e.g., is the thing I'm about to say going to help me win my lane, take objectives, or lead to victory?)
3. Is what i'm saying/doing good for others?  (e.g., is telling someone that they're bad or did something poorly a few minutes ago actually going to help them right now? is it going to teach them something, or help them perform better in game, or increase the team's odds of making better decisions and winning? is it going to make people laugh or have a more enjoyable time? Is it going to have negative consequences for others, make them feel worse, or perform worse? are my positive intentions getting blocked by my choice of words and coming across the wrong way?)

...If I'm not getting a clear 'Yes' on all 3 questions, there's usually something I can improve, and an increased chance I'm going to come off offensive or unsportsmanlike in some way.

Basically it comes down to this:
1. Please don't call for reports. Just don't do it.
2. Consider the implications of the things being said, because at the end of the day, people will remember the way you made them feel, but not necessarily the specific words you've used.
3. Think about and be honest with the consequences of your words. If words didn't have power, we wouldn't be using them.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}

I think an aspect of calling for reports that Riot really should tackle is the belief by many players that the more reports someone gets in a single game the more likely they are to get punished. This of course isn't true as you know, but a huge percentage of players believe that to be how it works. If no one believed this there would possibly be no one telling people to report others.

I feel that Riot should do a worldwide PSA in client that tells everyone this. It still wouldn't convince everyone of course but it would let many know who currently don't and could significantly reduce the number of instances of this behavior. It might be worth while to repeat this PSA every 6 months or so to catch new and returning players.
{{sticker:sg-lux}}

Ah there it is.
Griefing, flaming, inflammatory, and harassment. 
This is what you must have done consistently in order to get a 14-day ban. If you continue on this path, it'll be your last shot.
Because then you'll lose the account completely. The Terms of Use is there for you to understand what actions not to take and warn you what will happen if you do. 

If you want to keep using Riot's account you're using, the only responsibility you have, as everyone else, you abide by the rules. 
If someone is distracting you from this game, and creating a negative influence on you or the team, you mute that individual or players. There's no excuse not to use the mute function. That's the purpose of it.
Like I said, It's not anymore different than what I already posted. You guys are clowns.

Add in a report fiora and its the same exact log. I am seriously shocked in how I'm penalized when I was being harassed the whole game by all 3 players. You can't even deny that. I'm still going to push to have this ban overturned as it STILL doesn't classify as constant harassment. Since you're so smart, why don't you post the other players chat so you can show everyone I was being VERBALLY HARASSED.

Because the case isn't about them or what they said.
This isn't a dispute. This is about what you said and what you did. 
If they're penalized then they'll have their own case and you nor anyone else would be included in that case. The players who respond to negativity and continues it is just as bad as those who start it.

Doesn't matter if it's not any more "different" than what you originally posted. You left out evidence. Which shows you're even more guilty and proves you had something to hide.

At least being a clown can uphold their responsibilities and not hide facts.

But I can see you're not going to learn from your mistakes. I told you what you needed to do. What you do with that, I really don't care. I stated what needed to be stated, and I advise you to take that information and follow it. That's if you want to remain to keep that account. Either way, it's a win-win for me and the community. Either you don't abide by it and you get banned, then that's one less toxic player. Or you do abide by it and you're no longer toxic.

Good luck.
Hopefully, you choose the latter.

Your downvotes say otherwise. Also, I am not that one guy. I am just me doing what I do.
This is why you earned yourself that banned. Because you're sensitive and take everything negatively. What you have to realize one chat or even 3, doesn't get you banned. It gets you penalized. You earned enough penalty to get to the point of being banned.

 If you continue on this path, then, in reality, you're the one who stinks. Riot takes out the ones who truly stinks.

Permanently. 

I suggest you not being THAT guy.

But if I am any "guy", then I am the guy with my one original account since 2008 that never had to come here for a penalty. Even better, I never will. Because I am not THAT guy. You know.. the one that really stinks and Riot takes out? Yea.. That guy.

We're done here. Good luck.
As I said, hopefully, you do choose the latter of what I suggested earlier.

These logs aren't even ban worthy, why don't you post the full logs so we can see what they're saying to him? you cant ban somebody for defending themself.  In fact if these players are being toxic to him why dont you do something about it? Your ban system is terrible as is.

Ban worthy? No.
Penalizable worthy? Yes.
What you're missing here, is that the OP did this consistently. Meaning repeatedly. He went through 3 strikes to get this ban.

The Terms of Use advise not to use any sort of toxicity. That includes retaliation.
This game isn't about chatting back at your team and fighting with them. This game is about playing the game to win. If you're here to play the game, then play the game. If you're here to argue, insult, and harass players who insulted you, then find a chatroom. 

Also, if you want to do something about toxic players, then do what other players did to this OP. Report them. This is the results. This is what happens when you respond with negativity instead of playing the game like it was meant for.
Because if you respond with negativity and continue to do so instead of playing the game, then this consequences. Because no one wants to see their teammate fights. Because that is everything that this game stands for. People in this game forget this is a video game. Wanna stand up for yourself? Then do it right. Mute and report them. Because much like this OP, toxic players gets what coming.

> [{quoted}](name=Zombie Gerbil,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=blsvU1r0,comment-id=000700030000000000010000,timestamp=2018-06-30T06:33:32.837+0000)
>
> Ban worthy? No.
> Penalizable worthy? Yes.

Depending on how game went (because we don't know who the fault was for the feeding and bad team environment), this chat could not even be punishable material. 

I'm sorry, but the biggest problem of the current report system is that people do not report properly, as people do not really report as much as they should people behaving in a manner that damage your team (not talking about having bad games, I'm talking about having behaviour like not listening to call or advices or responding to them in a toxic manner), and it's enough to have a spike in reports in a pair of consecutive games because players decide to gang up on you to get a punshiment despite actually having toxic/feeders players causing the problems, but people will get annoyed at you for calling out these people, which in this case happened to be the third punishment, which is not a light punishment (14-day ban is a pretty heavy punishment)

It is not enough to say "just mute", because then this people will go unpunished for the reason above, and a lot of toxic players will go on and on ruining games, and it's enough that these players have some good games next, or games where people do not care to use the report feature properly, to have no further consequences going forward.

And, as the premise, I'm not even saying he is not guilty, it really depends on how the game went, because it could be a case of the OP making false accusations and creating himself a bad environment picking on players that just tried but had bad games because he was bad on his jungling role and they were putting in trouble by his play  - after all, level 21 account with 3 punishment is a pretty big red flag on OP -, or it could be a case of people legit reporting him in an unfair manner, we just don't know, and games like those should be heavily analized by Rioters with their tools, which should include the complete game chats (as we see only a small part of them) and tools to analyze game actions through the logs

In a vacuum, though, there is no way you can say these are penalizable worthy material, because there is no way you can actually estabilish if he was in right in defending himself or he was an toxic a*shole making false accusations, only Rioters know

The Riot nor the board disputes who started what.
It's about what they continue to do. OP has a history of doing the same negative thing that led him to get banned.

I've been here since 2008 and I've been told I've been reported throughout those years endlessly.
Never once banned. I currently still use the same account. No one is in the right at defending themselves unless they mute them. Yes, the mute function does work. This is coming from a beta player. Yes, the report function does work properly, because OP is a good example of the rest of the posters who post on this board every day. No reports are viable unless someone did something wrong. OP did just that. The Rioter provided his chat-log.

End of discussion. 
He got what he deserves.

Good day

> [{quoted}](name=DuckCurry,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=blsvU1r0,comment-id=000700030000,timestamp=2018-06-30T01:02:26.627+0000)
>
> Here's the actual in-game log:

Man if these logs are punishable you can punish 95% of the player base at any given time. 

When you said "The first thing I noticed is that the logs posted here have been modified and aren't the complete logs provided in your reform card." I thought there was gonna be some smoking gun line where he threatened someone, but yikes not much there outside of talking a lot.

Racism and hate speech isn't the only thing that can get you a 14-day ban.  The punishment system has 4 tiers and every time you get punished you move up the tier;

1. 10 games chat restriction 
2. 25-game chat reatriction 
3. 14-day ban 
4. Permaban 

If you have continue to have disruptive behavior over many games (regardless of how mild the toxicity is), it will eventually get you permabanned.

Btw, quick skim through those logs that DuckCurry posted, it looks like your been asking for reports in the form of harassment. That is considered mild toxicity and is punishable when you do it often enough.

Didn't think so, and I'm still confused as to why I was penalized. With that being said, I believe my almost 10 year tenure of playing league is coming to an end. I can understand being subject to such childish behavior from players in game but from a Rioter, is extremely uncalled for. Long term players such as myself will band together and watch this awesome game burn. Goodbye Riot. 

Sincerely, 

A 9 year client.

Oh silly you, so many people before you have said the similar thing.
But don't worry, you won't be the last silly person to say such things.

You know first hand this beautiful game won't be going anywhere. Enjoy your leave!

I did not say the game was going away. It's just not going to attract well mannered players who honestly just want to see victory across their screen. Your beautiful game will become a meme. I already got one!

Riot: PERMANENT BAN.

5.1. Can I troll, flame, threaten or harass people while using the Riot Services? (No. If you do, you might get banned.)

I am quite sure you did flame them or something because you didn't like what they said.
Or harassed them about it. Either way, we'll get know exactly what you left out and what you truly said. Because whatever you did, you did it consistently.

No, I did not flame them or constantly badger them. unfortunately. That's why Ducky probably won't post it. When your teammates call you a f***ing idiot all game and keep saying "kayn trash jg" x10 its hard to keep a positive attitude. I hate to play the victim card but I was in fact the victim. But I still didn't let them get the best of me and did not harass or call them names such as they did me.

Such cruelty! Oh man, that must be hard to deal with. Seriously intolerable.
In such a case, you are a victim if you're powerless with no ability to stop them saying such things.. The internet is such a cruel place when they just simply harass you and insult you over and over again with no ability or function to stop it. 

They need something like a silence function to mute the players chat... something like.. let's say a mute function! If only they had a mute function so where you don't have to respond to such toxicity and tipping off your anger and prevent you from being negative... 

Oh wait, they do! 

But instead, you disregarded your only responsibility and disregarded the terms of use.
Seriously, man, you couldn't be responsible enough just to mute them? Just because you're on the internet playing a video game doesn't mean responsibilities doesn't apply to you.

It's punishable for calling reports. If you do that constantly it builds up to your account as constant harassment. I report people who calls reports in my games so their accounts sooner or later would get rekt.

Post chat logs.

It doesn't matter if 9 people report you. It only gets flagged once if it's legitimate so more people reporting you doesn't hold any more weight than one person. If you're so innocent as you claim, which I doubt, then you wouldn't have been banned. Simple as that.

No I promise you, I don't use racial slurs, I don't flame in chat I just simply nod my head at all the criticism and carry on with my game. No matter how verbally abusive my team might be. It really only matters how many reports are sent out against a player that game. If 3/5 people on your team report you I promise you will receive a penalty. This has gotten to the point where I refuse to type to my teammates AT ALL, and guess what? I still receive penalties. Like I said, my 3/5 teammates were flaming me in chat calling me a f****** idiot and I STILL get banned. I did not curse or backlash, I'm simply just trying to play the game.

If you have nothing to hide and as I said, are as innocent as you claim, then you shouldn't have a problem posting your chat logs to prove that you said nothing back, especially after you're going to speak nonsense about riot wrongfully banning you.

I rarely post a comment on LoL forums but it touches me quite personally since I got in a similar situation months ago. 
I got a 14-day ban because I said "I thought we were *Homophobic word*", replying to a Tristana who said herself *same homophobic word* first. 
I immediately contacted Riot support and at first they sent me a generic answer telling me that it is a deserved ban. 
Then I came across an article about people abusing ban system and randomly make people get banned by using specific words. I immediately sent the article to the support and within a few hours they lifted the ban, retrieving my honor and Victorious Graves skin. But I still got a warning for what I did and I clearly understand and accept that. 

My chat log was even less big than yours, I rarely chat but still... Sure riot ban system is sometimes quite questionable, but often it IS deserved. Honestly, if I had been in your game, I would also report you, not because you didn't gank me or anything else like that: we all can have bad games sometimes (not performing well I mean). But more because you prevented me from having a good game (not necessarily meaning win, but you prevent me from performing good) by harassing, writing useless and tilting things on chat, spam pinging etc... When you prevent someone from having a good game, then you deserve a report. 

You have a problem with mates talking, blaming, flaming too much ? Mute them, then report then if necessary. You had tools to prevent your ban, you didn't use them though.
